Managed.description: If true, the FSM transitions are managed by an external tool.

StepByStep.description: If true and the FSM is self-managed, transitions should be triggered step by step.

IdleKeepState.description: If true, the state is kept until transition; otherwise, FSM holds the last state until transition.

StatesLibraries.description: List of paths to state libraries.

StatesFiles.description: List of paths to state files.

VerboseStateFactory.description: If true, state factory will be more verbose.

robots.title: Additional Robots
robots.description: Additional robots to load. Keys are robot names, values are robot module definitions or visual geometry.

module.description: Module name: this can be any robot module name, robot alias (such as env/ground or object/box), or any path supported by RobotLoader

init_pos.description: Initial position of the robot in the world frame.
Initial position of the robot in the world frame.

constraints.description: General constraints, always on. Each item must match one of the allowed constraint schemas.

<robot_name>.description: Options for the robot with name <robot_name>.

states.description: Additional text states. Each state should derive from a 'base' state, which can be one of the following: - a C++ or Python state within StatesLibraries - a YAML state defined within StatesFiles - a state defined within this 'states' property. See State objects
states.descriptionHtml:
Additional text states. Each state should derive from a 'base' state, which can be one of the following:
  • a C++ or Python state within StatesLibraries
  • a YAML state defined within StatesFiles
  • a state defined within this 'states' property.
  • See State objects

transitions.description: Transitions array. Each item is an array: [from, event, to, type].

Robot.description: Robot module definition. Specifies the robot module to load.

RobotOptions.description: Options for a specific robot, such as posture and feedforward task settings.

Transition.description: A transition definition: [from, event, to, type].
